text: {{Infobox writer | name = Anita Brookner | image = | caption = Anita Brookner | pseudonym = | birth_date = | birth_place = Herne Hill, London, United Kingdom | alma_mater = King's College London | death_date = | death_place = | occupation = Art historian & novelist | genre = Drama | movement = | spouse = | children = |signature = | website = | notablework = Hotel du Lac | period = 1981–2011 }} Anita Brookner, CBE (16 July 1928 – 10 March 2016) was a British award-winning novelist and art historian. She was Slade Professor of Fine Art at the University of Cambridge from 1967 to 1968. She was the first woman to hold this visiting professorship. She was awarded the 1984 Man Booker Prize for her novel Hotel du Lac. ==References== ==Other websites== *Anita Brookner Collection at the Harry Ransom Center at the University of Texas at Austin * Category:1928 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Art historians Category:Historians from London
